StoredQueryDescription.Title: ECMWF Pressure Grid
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: ECMWF forecast model's pressure levels as a grid data encoded in GRIB format.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

Parameter.name: levels
Parameter.Title: Pressure levels
Parameter.Abstract: A comma separated list of pressure levels (For example 1000,925,850).

Parameter.name: format
Parameter.Title: Dataset format.
Parameter.Abstract: Encoding format for the returned dataset. Formats available are grib1, grib2 and netcdf. Default format is grib2.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: ECMWF weather forecast for cities in Finland as multipointcoverage
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This stored query fetch ECMWF weather forecast for cities in Finland. The forcast is returned in multi point coverage format. By default, forcast is returned for the next 36 hours.

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: The parameter specifies the end of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: timestep
Parameter.Title: The time step of data in minutes
Parameter.Abstract: The time step of data in minutes. Notice that timestep is calculated from start of the ongoing hour or day.

Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: ECMWF surface level weather forecast for Finland as a grid.
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This Stored Query request retrieve ECMWF surface level forecast raw dataset as a grid for Finland region.

Parameter.name: producer
Parameter.Title: Producer
Parameter.Abstract: Model or process which provides the data.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter starttime specifies the begin of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter endtime specifies the end of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return. Default parameters are Temperature, Pressure, Humidity, DewPoint, WindUMS, WindVMS and Precipitation1h.

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (min Longitude, min Latitude, max Longitude, max Latitude) Default bounding box is 19.1,59.7,31.7,70.1.

Parameter.name: format
Parameter.Title: Dataset format.
Parameter.Abstract: Encoding format for the returned dataset. Formats available are grib1, grib2 and netcdf. Default format is General Regularly-distributed Information in Binary form edition 2 (GRIB2).

In addition to default parameters, there is 'RadiationDiffuseAccumulation' parameter that is not distributed in grib2 format. Parameter.name: format
Parameter.Title: Dataset format.
Parameter.Abstract: Encoding format for the returned dataset. Formats available are grib1, grib2 and netcdf. Default format is General Regularly-distributed Information in Binary form edition 2 (GRIB2).

StoredQueryDescription.Title: FMI-ENFUSER air quality forecast as grid
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: FMI-ENFUSER (The Finnish Meteorological Institute's ENvironmental information FUsion SERvice) is a novel air quality model that combines dispersion modelling techniques, information fusion algorithms and statistical approaches. The operational modelling system provides both real-time and forecasted, high resolution information on the urban air quality. This stored query provides near real-time information on Helsinki metropolitan air quality with a resolution of ~20m for the hourly concentrations of PM2.5, PM10, NO2, O3 and Air Quality Index (in a scale of 1 to 5) as a grid. New dataset will come available once in an hour.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter specifies the begin of time interval to return data in ISO 8601 format (for example 2017-01-25T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter specifies the end of time interval to return data in ISO 8601 format (for example 2017-01-25T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Harmonie Scandinavia Hybrid Weather Forecast as Grid data
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The stored query can be used to fetch Harmonie hybrid weather forecast data encoded in GRIB or NetCDF format. The model data covers the geographical area of Scandinavia and hybrid levels from 65 (near the model topography) to 12 (highest available elevation). New forecast dataset will come available every 6 hours. By default all the parameters, levels and timesteps are selected.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2017-07-07T07:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2017-07-07T07:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

Parameter.name: levels
Parameter.Title: Hybrid levels
Parameter.Abstract: A comma separated list of levels (For example 40,30,20). By default all available levels are selected.

Parameter.name: format
Parameter.Title: Dataset format.
Parameter.Abstract: Encoding format for the returned dataset. Formats available are grib1, grib2 and netcdf. Default format is grib2.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Harmonie Hybrid Point Weather Forecast as multipointcoverage
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The stored query can be used to fetch Harmonie hybrid weather forecast data in multi point coverage format. The model data covers the geographical area of Scandinavia and heights between 13 and 10000 meters from the model topography. New forecast dataset will come available every 6 hours. Location need to be specified as place or geoid or latlon query parameters. By default data will be returned from the height of 100 meters above the model topography and 50 hours from the request time.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Harmonie Hybrid Point Weather Forecast as simple features
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The stored query can be used to fetch Harmonie hybrid weather forecast data in simple feature format. The model data covers the geographical area of Scandinavia and heights between 13 and 10000 meters from the model topography. New forecast dataset will come available every 6 hours. Location need to be specified as place or geoid or latlon query parameters. By default data will be returned from the height of 100 meters above the model topography and 50 hours from the request time.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Harmonie Scandinavia Pressure Level Weather Forecast as Grid data
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The stored query can be used to fetch Harmonie weather forecast data from pressure levels encoded in GRIB or NetCDF format. The model data covers the geographical area of Scandinavia and pressure levels: 300, 500, 700, 850, 925, 1000 hPa. New forecast dataset will come available every 6 hours. By default all the parameters, levels and timesteps are selected.

Parameter.Abstract: A comma separated list of pressure levels (For example 400,850,1000). By default all available levels are selected.

Parameter.Title: Dataset format.
Parameter.Abstract: Encoding format for the returned dataset. Formats available are grib1, grib2 and netcdf. Default format is grib2.

Parameter.name: height
Parameter.Title: Height from the topography of forecast model
Parameter.Abstract: The request parameter specifies height in meters from the topography of forecast model.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Harmonie (MEPS) Hybrid Point Weather Forecast as simple features
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The stored query can be used to fetch Harmonie (MEPS) hybrid weather forecast data in simple feature format. The model data covers the geographical area of Scandinavia and heights between 13 and 10000 meters from the model topography. New forecast dataset will come available every 6 hours. Location need to be specified as place or geoid or latlon query parameters. By default data will be returned from the height of 100 meters above the model topography and 50 hours from the request time.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter specifies the begin of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter specifies the end of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: timestep
Parameter.Title: The time step of data in minutes
Parameter.Abstract: The time step of data in minutes. Notice that timestep is calculated from start of the ongoing hour or day.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Harmonie (MEPS) Scandinavia Pressure Level Weather Forecast as Grid data
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The stored query can be used to fetch Harmonie (MEPS) weather forecast data from pressure levels encoded in GRIB or NetCDF format. The model data covers the geographical area of Scandinavia and pressure levels: 300, 500, 700, 850, 925, 1000 hPa. New forecast dataset will come available every 6 hours. By default all the parameters, levels and timesteps are selected.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2017-07-07T07:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2017-07-07T07:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

Parameter.name: levels
Parameter.Title: Pressure levels
Parameter.Abstract: A comma separated list of pressure levels (For example 400,850,1000). By default all available levels are selected.

Parameter.name: format
Parameter.Title: Dataset format.
Parameter.Abstract: Encoding format for the returned dataset. Formats available are grib1, grib2 and netcdf. Default format is grib2.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: SILAM air quality forecast as grid
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: SILAM (System for Integrated modeLling of Atmospheric coMposition) is a global-to-meso-scale dispersion model developed for atmospheric composition, air quality, and emergency decision support applications. This stored query provides an air quality forecast for the main ambient pollutants: CO, NO, NO2, O3, SO2, PM10 and PM25. The model data covers the geographical area of Europe. New forecast dataset will come available once in a day. The data is returened as a grid. Output file format is NetCDF.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2017-01-25T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO 8601 format (for example 2017-01-25T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: SILAM air quality forecast as as time value pairs
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: SILAM (System for Integrated modeLling of Atmospheric coMposition) is a global-to-meso-scale dispersion model developed for atmospheric composition, air quality, and emergency decision support applications. This stored query provides an air quality forecast for the main ambient pollutants: CO, NO, NO2, O3, SO2, PM10 and PM25. The model data covers the geographical area of Europe. New forecast dataset will come available once in a day. The data is returened as as time value pairs.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Hourly Air Quality Observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Hourly air quality observations from weather stations of Finnish Meteorological Institute. By default, all the station are selected and the data is returned from the last 24 hours. The data is returned as multi point coverage format.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Salinity and Water temperature observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Salinity and water temperature observations (CTD observations) from fixed locations. Available parameters are water temperature, salinity, conductivity, density, and the speed of sound as a function of water pressure (corresponding approximately to depth). The data is returned in multipointcoverage format.

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return. By default all parameters will be returned.

Parameter.name: crs
Parameter.Title: Coordinate projection to use in results
Parameter.Abstract: Coordinate projection to use in results. For example EPSG::3067

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.name: place
Parameter.Title: The location for which to provide data
Parameter.Abstract: The location for which to provide forecast. Region can be given after location name separated by comma (for example Hanko).

Parameter.name: fmisid
Parameter.Title: FMI observation station identifier.
Parameter.Abstract: Identifier of the observation station.

Parameter.name: maxlocations
Parameter.Title: Amount of locations
Parameter.Abstract: How many observation stations are fetched around queried locations. Note that stations are only searched with 50 kilometers radius around the location.

Parameter.name: geoid
Parameter.Title: Geoid of the location for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Geoid of the location for which to return data. (ID from geonames.org)

Parameter.name: wmo
Parameter.Title: WMO code of the location for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: WMO code of the location for which to return data.

Parameter.name: latlon
Parameter.Title: Location coordinates to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Location coordinates to return data (lat,lon). For example 61.2,21

Parameter.name: timezone
Parameter.Title: Time zone
Parameter.Abstract: Time zone of the time instant of the data point in the form Area/Location (for example America/Costa_Rica). Default value is UTC.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Monthly water level and temperature observations of 30-year normal period.
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Monthly water level and temperature observations of 30-year normal period 1991 - 2020. Notice that there is only data at the begin of each month of the first year of the period. By default data is returned from 15 locations. The data is returned in simple feature format.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: timestep
Parameter.Title: The time step of data in minutes
Parameter.Abstract: The time step of data in minutes. Notice that timestep is calculated from start of the ongoing hour or day.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Sun Radiation Observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Sun radiation observations from weather stations. By default the data is returned from last 1 hour and from stations in Sodankyl, Jokioinen, Helsinki, Parainen, Vantaa, Jyvskyl, Sotkamo and Utsjoki. The data is returned in 'multipointcoverage' format.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Manual Sea Ice Observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Manually made sea ice observations from The Baltic Sea. By default, the data is returned from last 30 days. At least one location parameter (geoid/place/fmisid/wmo/bbox/latlon) has to be given. The data is returned as a time value pair format.

Parameter.name: place

Parameter.Title: FMI observation station identifier.
Parameter.Abstract: Identifier of the observation station.

Parameter.name: maxlocations

Parameter.name: timezone
Parameter.Title: Time zone
Parameter.Abstract: Time zone of the time instant of the data point in the form Area/Location (for example America/Costa_Rica). Default value is UTC.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Dropsonde observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This stored query returns atmospheric dropsonde observations in multipointcoverage format. By default dropsonde observations are returned from the observation stations of Finland the last 12 hours.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Hourly Weather Observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Hourly weather observations from weather stations. Default set contains hourly air temperature average, maximum and minimum, air relative humidity average, wind speed average, minumum (10 minute average) and maximum (10 minute average), wind direction average, wind gust speed maximum (3 second average), rain accumulated, rain intensity maximum, air pressure average and the most significant weather code. By default, the data is returned from last 24 hours. At least one location parameter (geoid/place/fmisid/wmo/bbox) has to be given. The data is returned in multi point coverage format.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Monthly weather observations of 30-year normal period
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Monthly Weather Observations of 30-year normal period. By default, the data is returned from the normal period of 1991 - 2020. There is available the following normal periods: 1971 - 2000, 1981 - 2010, 1991 - 2020. Notice that there is only data at the begin of the period. At least one location parameter (geoid/place/fmisid/wmo/bbox) has to be given. The data is returned in multi point coverage format.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Instantaneous Weather Observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Real time weather observations from weather stations. Default set contains wind speed, direction, gust, temperature, relative humidity, dew point, pressure reduced to sea level, one hour precipitation amount, visibility and cloud cover. By default, the data is returned from last 12 hour. At least one location parameter (geoid/place/fmisid/wmo/bbox) has to be given. The data is returned as a simple feature format.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: timestep
Parameter.Title: The time step of data in minutes
Parameter.Abstract: The time step of data in minutes. Notice that timestep is calculated from start of the ongoing hour or day.

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

Parameter.name: crs
Parameter.Title: Coordinate projection to use in results
Parameter.Abstract: Coordinate projection to use in results. For example EPSG::3067

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62

Parameter.Title: The location for which to provide data
Parameter.Abstract: The location for which to provide data. Region can be given after location name separated by comma (for example Kumpula,Kolari).

StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This stored query returns atmospheric sounding observations in multipointcoverage format. By default sounding observations are returned from the observation stations of Finland the last 12 hours.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Yearly weather observations of 30-year normal period
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Yearly Weather Observations of 30-year normal period. By default, the data is returned from the normal period of 1991 - 2020. There is available the following normal periods: 1971 - 2000, 1981 - 2010, 1991 - 2020. Notice that there is only data at the begin of the period. At least one location parameter (geoid/place/fmisid/wmo/bbox) has to be given. The data is returned in multi point coverage format.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Instantaneous Road Weather Observations
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: Real time road weather observations from road weather stations. By default, essential parameters are returned from last 20 minutes. At least one location parameter (geoid/place/fmisid/bbox) has to be given. The data is returned as a time value pair format.

Parameter.name: starttime
Parameter.Title: Begin of the time interval
Parameter.Abstract: Parameter begin specifies the begin of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: endtime
Parameter.Title: End of time interval
Parameter.Abstract: End of time interval in ISO-format (for example 2012-02-27T00:00:00Z).

Parameter.name: timestep
Parameter.Title: The time step of data in minutes
Parameter.Abstract: The time step of data in minutes. Notice that timestep is calculated from start of the ongoing hour or day.

Parameter.name: parameters
Parameter.Title: Parameters to return
Parameter.Abstract: Comma separated list of meteorological parameters to return.

Parameter.name: crs
Parameter.Title: Coordinate projection to use in results
Parameter.Abstract: Coordinate projection to use in results. For example EPSG::3067

Parameter.name: bbox
Parameter.Title: Bounding box of area for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Bounding box of area for which to return data (lon,lat,lon,lat). For example 21,61,22,62.

Parameter.name: place
Parameter.Title: The location for which to provide data
Parameter.Abstract: The location for which to provide forecast. Region can be given after location name separated by comma (for example Rovaniemi).

Parameter.name: fmisid
Parameter.Title: FMI observation station identifier.
Parameter.Abstract: Identifier of the observation station.

Parameter.name: maxlocations
Parameter.Title: Amount of locations
Parameter.Abstract: How many observation stations are fetched around queried locations. Note that stations are only searched with 50 kilometers radius around the location (place/fmisid/geoid). By default, one location is returned.

Parameter.name: geoid
Parameter.Title: Geoid of the location for which to return data.
Parameter.Abstract: Geoid of the location for which to return data. (ID from geonames.org)

Parameter.name: timezone
Parameter.Title: Time zone
Parameter.Abstract: Time zone of the time instant of the data point in the form Area/Location (for example America/Costa_Rica). Default value is UTC.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Radioactivity in outdoor air
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This stored query returns only the latest results of the measurement of the radioactivity samples collected by special equipment. At monitoring station samples are created by pumping high volumes of air through glass fibre filter. In Finland there are 8 monitoring stations. By default all the monitoring stations are selected and the latest results of measurements are search from the last 720 hours. The default values can be overwritten by using the time and location related input parameters.

Parameter.Title: FMI observation station identifier.
Parameter.Abstract: Identifier of the observation station.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Radioactivity in outdoor air
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This stored query return only the latest results of measurement of radioactivity samples collected by special equipment that filtering outdoor air in the monitoring stations in Finland. By default all the monitoring stations are selected and the latest results of measurements are search from the last 720 hours. The default values can be overwritten by using the time and location related input parameters. Notice that a result member contains the coordinates of a monitoring station, the endtime of sample collection period, a nuclide code and measured activity concentration.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: Latest dose rate of external radiation in Finland
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: This stored query return the latest results of the external dose rate measured by the automatic dose rate monitoring stations in Finland. The automatic dose rate monitoring network have about 255 monitoring stations distributed evenly around the Finland. The monitoring network is maintained by Radiation and Nuclear Safety Authority (STUK). By default, the latest data is searched from the last 24 hours. The data is returned as a multipointcoverage format. The default values can be overwritten by using the time and location related input parameters.

Parameter.Abstract: Time zone of the time instant of the data point in the form Area/Location (for example America/Costa_Rica). Default value is UTC.

StoredQueryDescription.Title: GetFeatureById
StoredQueryDescription.Abstract: The GetFeatureById stored query is mandatory by WFS 2.0 spec. In the FMI case it's mostly useless however, because most of the features only have temporary IDs that are generated on-the-fly during the response generation, and thus cannot be used as permanent identifiers for those features

Parameter.name: id
Parameter.Title: Stored Query ID
Parameter.Abstract: [Mandatory] Specifies ID of stored query to invoke

QueryExpressionText.returnFeatureTypes: wfs_001:BsWfsElement wfs_002:EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility wfs_002:EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork wfs_003:GridSeriesObservation wfs_003:PointObservation wfs_003:PointTimeSeriesObservation wfs_003:ProfileObservation wfs_004:TrajectoryObservation
